title: General Tso's Salmon with Roasted Veggies and Rice
directions: Slice zucchini and squash into half-moons. Toss with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on a sheet pan.
Roast veggies alone for 10 minutes to give them a head start.
While veggies roast, pat salmon dry. Season with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and ginger powder. Brush a thin layer of General Tso's sauce on top.
After 10 minutes, push veggies to one half of the pan. Place salmon on the other half. Add a little more oil to veggies if they look dry.
Roast everything together for 10-12 more minutes until salmon is flaky and veggies are lightly browned.
Remove from oven. Brush another spoonful of General Tso's sauce on the salmon while hot. Let sit 2 minutes so the glaze sticks.
Serve in a bowl: rice on bottom, veggies next, salmon on top with the sticky glaze. Drizzle a small amount of extra sauce over everything. Garnish with sesame seeds or green onion.
notes: Uses bottled General Tso's sauce for convenience. Don't stack too many seasonings since the sauce has a strong profile already. Keep extras simple: salt, pepper, garlic powder, ginger powder. For pan-seared version: sear salmon skin-side down 3-4 min, flip 2 min, drop heat to medium-low, add 2-3 tbsp sauce, let it bubble 1-2 min. If using two oven racks, put salmon on middle rack and veggies on lower rack, swap halfway through.
